column1: It was great to be in Barbourville today with my friend @senatemajldr Mitch McConnell. Barbourville ARH Union College Grace Community Health and other small businesses received millions in COVID-relief funding thanks to the CARES Act. https://t.co/xjvAhvRsnS
President Trump and the First Lady are in my thoughts and prayers this morning. It is my hope that they recover quickly from COVID-19 so they can continue their critical work for the American people.

I applaud @usaid Acting Admin. John Barsa for standing strong for unborn children around the world in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. Mr. Barsa condemned the UN & Global HRP for advancing access to abortion as an “essential service." Read more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua

COVID-19 RELIEF FUNDING UPDATE: The House just passed the bipartisan Paycheck Protection Program & Health Care Enhancement Act adding more than $480 billion in emergency COVID-19 relief funds for small businesses hospitals & expanded testing. Details @ https://t.co/Vb958QsaNT
@samhsagov released $2 Million in Emergency Grants for Kentucky to address substance use treatment & serious mental illnesses during the COVID-19 pandemic. Details @ https://t.co/dNXo6GT7Lf

Once again WHO's actions are raising red flags. The COVID-19 pandemic has required a rapid response around the globe yet this leading health organization has fallen short and its credibility continues to suffer. (2/3)

One single no vote on the CARES Act will not stop this critical COVID-19 relief package. It would be a disappointing and unnecessary delay but I want to assure Kentuckians that this bill will pass despite those who choose to put politics above the American people. #PassTheBill

I applaud the Senate for passing the Families First Coronavirus Response Act the 2nd round of legislation that has now been approved by this Congress to combat the COVID-19 crisis. Learn more about our united efforts at https://t.co/R784aaJgmB.

Stay up to date on news related to the Coronavirus at https://t.co/KIEJs3hfop. If you need assistance all of my Kentucky District Offices remain open in Somerset Hazard and Prestonsburg. Office information is available at https://t.co/q4qhhAF5Su.

The House just passed the bipartisan Families First Coronavirus Response Act to help protect American families and businesses during this pandemic.  Highlights include: ✅Free testing for COVID-19 ✅Additional paid sick leave ✅Extended food aid Details @ https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua
This morning I asked Sec. Mnuchin about actions to address how the coronavirus is impacting the health of the U.S. economy. Learn more about this responses: https://t.co/5xkrv6w7Ha

The House just passed an emergency funding package to address the coronavirus at home and overseas. It will expedite vaccine development provide funds to purchase equipment and supplies & includes $1 billion for state and local response efforts. Details@ https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/J24HX49ShH
